On 06/03/2011 20:27, Colin Green wrote:
> So assuming for now that nature /is/ using junk DNA as a source of
> noise for connection patterns *and* that there is an easier to
> discover source, the question becomes - why use junk DNA?

As a 'comer-in' to this subject, I'm probably not best placed to 
comment, but as I see it, nature doesn't take the easier path, it takes 
a random path. So despite a stepping stone along the path appearing to 
be the easy option, I would suggest a better way of putting it, would be 
to say, that it has a higher probability of occurring (but higher by how 
much?). Nature might well opt for the weird low probability. Perhaps a 
bit like quantum tunnelling (or the infinite improbability drive).

-- 
Rob Marsden
Gistix (Northern) Limited
